review_blob:
Poured from bottle into big Bordeaux glass.
Quite a lot going on in the aroma. Banana, classic spicy notes from yeast, peppery, musty, moldy, earthy. Taste is very dry, spicy, earthy, less fruit in taste than in aroma, but still there. Long, very dry finish. Mouthfeel was a bit more substantial than with other saisons, very high carbonation. Overall, it might be a bit young, but one of the best saisons Ive had, gotta go stock up.
UPDATED: JAN 20, 2013

Had a sample at the brewery.
Poured a cloudy yellow-orange color, a bit darker than the avg wheat beer. Aroma and flavors of banana and clove, and some toasty wheat. Carbonation was average for the style.

Poured from a growler.
A fairly clear orange/copper colour. Aroma was a bit hard to find. Tasted grainy... but with some uncharictaristic caramel/toasty flavors which dont go with Kolsch. Well balanced. A bit fruity.
Overall, an OK beer, but not really a Kolsch.

beer_brewer_name: Merchant Ale House / Murray Street Brewing
review_blob:
A first for the Merchant ALE House from what I can remember.

Good clarity. Aroma was floral with some grains in the background. Tasted pretty decent, hop bitterness to balance, medium bodied. Carbonation I found a bit light. Long finish.

It was a good lager, but I will probably stick with thier other offerings that have bigger flavors.

Poured from a growler brought home from the brewpub.

Pours a light orange/amber hue. Medium sized white head. It quickly fades to a thin layer on top. Not really any lace. The aromas are very muted, some grainy/carmelly aroma. Taste was similar to how it smelled, muted flavours of caramel, honey, grainy flavour. Not a whole lot going on. An easy drinking med/light bodied Scottish Ale. Overall, its OK. Not the best Ive had from Taps.

One of the best beers Ive had from this brewery, almost as good as the Belgian IPA. Too bad the brewer left.

The aroma is big malts, some dark fruit, & vanilla. Its a deep black color, with tan head. Taste is big, very malty/roasty. Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, a bit sweet and warming. Its 9%, but the alcohol is well hidden, not hot. Big chewy mouthfeel, with low carbonation. It is served too cold at the brewpub, this is one that you have to let warm up. Overall, a great RIS. One iof the best that Ive had in the province this year.
beer_name: Taps Baltic Shipwreck Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob:
Had at the brewpub.

Served too cold as seems to be usual for this place, too bad.

Aroma was yeasty and hoppy. Good citrusy aromas, pears and apricots. Grapefruit, lemon. Cloves, banana, pepper.

Looks slightly hazy (unfiltered). It wasnt poured with much head, but what was there lasted, and left some lace on the glass. Golden color.

Taste was good, good bitterness. Citrusy, peaches, pine, grapefruit, lemon. Not much malt character. Dry, bitter finish.

Medium bodied, or a bit heavier maybe. Carbonation was a bit low for the style.

Overall, a great beer. Full of flavour, and good body. Will drink it again.

beer_brewer_name: Merchant Ale House / Murray Street Brewing
review_blob:
Aroma was very strong in the ginger department, very little if anything from anything else.

Looked slightly hazy. Reddish brown in colour. Small white head.

Tasteed similar to the nose. Very big ginger flavour, but not much else to back it up. It was real, fresh ginger Im sure, and if youre a big fan of ginger than you might take to this more than I did. 

Medium bodied. High carbonation. Served too cold.

Overall, nice to try, but not something I could drink much of. 
I will order it again though.
UPDATED: AUG 23, 2010

On tap at Taps.

In the aroma, I get clove upfront, followed by some banana. No vanilla at all. 

Looks hazy dark yellow. Small head, but the head lasted. I think it just wasnt poured with as much head as it should have been considering that it is a Weiss.

Tastes delicious. A bit more malty than your average wheat beer. Some banana and clove. No vannilla, zero. I was hoping to taste some vanilla, but was disappointed as I am a vanilla freak.

Palate was nice. Medium bodied. Lower carbonation than a normal wheat beer.

On tap at the brewpub. (this is a Dunkel Lager, not an Abbey Dubbel)

Aroma is very malty. Caramel, biscuit, bread, toffee.

It looks a dark brown with reddish highlights.

It tastes like the aroma would lead you, but it also has a bit of chocolate and nuttiness. It has a bit of sweetnes that lingers.

Mouthfeel is silky smooth, with a pleasant sparkle from the carbonation.

A real Bamburg-style rauchbier. Very smokey aroma, with a bit of malt peeking through the clouds of smoke.
Taste is same as the aroma, smokey, with some munich malt to back it up. The finish is dry, crisp and smokey. 
Good, appropriate level of carbonation really helps bring the smokey aroma up to your nose.

Its like Schlenkerla, but I could drink more of it.

Overall, a great rauchbier.

A guest tap at Taps On Queen in Niagara Falls.
Aroma is muted, but I pick up some caramel, biscuity malts, and citrus hops.
The server had trouble pouring it, the tap was just spitting foam at first. It was copper coloured, with a small white head that had poor retention. Little lace.
Tasted biscuity  and carmelly. Little hops, not much bitterness. Some citrus.
Medium bodied and lower than average carbonation (due to the foamy pour?).
Overall, I have to say that I expected more hops with a name like "Hoptical Illusion".
beer_name: Flying Monkeys Hoptical Illusion Almost Pale Ale

beer_brewer_name: Merchant Ale House / Murray Street Brewing
review_blob:
Aroma of espresso, roasted malts.
Black with beige coloured head. Medium head retention. Not much lace.
Tastes good, flavors of espresso, roasted malt. Not really much hops, but some bitterness is there to balance.
Full bodied. Carbonation is average, but would prefer a bit less.

One of the best stouts in the province, anyone with an appreciation for the style should try it.
beer_name: Merchant Ale House Drunken Monkey Oatmeal Stout

review_blob:
Aromas of dark roasted malts mostly. Coffee dominates, some dark chocolate, maybe.

It pours almost black, if you hold it to a light you can see some brown-red in it too. A small head was produced, medium head retention and moderate lacing.

Medium bodied. Average carbonation.
Overall, its a pretty good porter, but would have liked more of that sweet caramel flavour that I find in porters sometimes.

Aroma is malty with some piney hops.

Looks copper in colour. Nice thick rocky head.

Tastes both malty and hoppy. Good balance. Nice bitterness. Some pine, citrus, grass. Caramel, toffee.

Medium bodied. Average carbonation.

They shouldnt have attempted to classify this as a pale ale. Even if you take the appearance out of the equation, it doesnt conform to an English or American style Pale Ale.
The Aroma was a bit muted, but picked up some citrus and some caramel.
Looked brown with red highlights. Tan head, poor head retention. Little lace.
Was pretty tasty. Good balance between malts and hops. Good malty depth to it, while not becoming a malt dominated beer. Good subtle biterness, and hop flavours.
Average carbonation. Medium bodied.
A nice beer, worth a try.
beer_name: Great Lakes Brewing Devils Pale Ale 666
Dieu du Ciel Corne du Diable

review_blob:
Aromas all hops. English hops. Herbal, and citrusy. Lemon.

Was served with a little head that hung around for a minute. It was quite cloudy which isnt how a pale ale should be in my opinion.

Tasted great. Pine, citrus. There were some lemony notes there. The malt element wasnt all that interesting, but I think the brewer achieved a good balance between the hops and malt. Its almost like an American style pale ale, but with English hops.

Medium bodied, good carbonation.

Overall its a good pale ale. I would have liked to give it a higher rating, but I had to doc it some points on the appearance because of the cloudyness.
beer_name: Niagaras Best Portage Premium Pale Ale

review_blob:
You can really smell the dry hopping here. Aromas of grapefruit, orange peel, lemon, some spicy hop notes.

Great head on it that lasted and left some lacing on my glass. This is the only beer from this brewery that I can say really looked good, head-wise. A nice gold or sort of orange colour.

Tastes hoppy. Not sure that im tasting the rye or knot (teehehe), but I dont really know what to look for. Tastes citrusy and spicy. Good clean bitterness, and a tun of hop flavour. 

Nice palate fullness. Very nice body, sort of thick feeling but in a good way. The carbonation is a bit low, which i dont mind.

Overall, a great beer. In my opinion, its the best that this brewery has done.   On tap at the brewery/restaurant.

beer_brewer_name: Merchant Ale House / Murray Street Brewing
review_blob:
The aroma was dominated by the hops. Aromas of pine, and citrus were there.

Hazy. One finger of head. Poor head retention. Copper/ amber in colour.

Good hop flavouring; grassy, a little bit of citrus, pine. Good hop bittering too. Enough malt to stand up to the hops so it is not out of balance.

Overall, Its a nice juicy IPA
